title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: JapanAPIs package provides unified interface access open data World Bank API, Nager.Date API, REST Countries API, focus Japan. allows users retrieve --date historical information topics economic indicators, population statistics, national holidays, basic geopolitical details. addition API-access functions, package includes one largest curated collections open datasets related Japan. datasets cover wide range topics including natural disasters, economic production, vehicle industry, air quality, demographic trends, administrative divisions. JapanAPIs designed support users working data related Japan integrating international RESTful APIs structured reliable datasets public, academic, governmental sources single, easy--use R package.

title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: JapanAPIs package provides several core functions access real-time structured information Japan public APIs World Bank API, Nager.Date, REST Countries API. list main functions included package: get_japan_child_mortality(): Get -5 Mortality Rate Japan World Bank get_japan_cpi(): Get Japan’s Consumer Price Index World Bank get_japan_energy_use(): Get Japan’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) World Bank get_japan_gdp(): Get Japan’s GDP (Current US$) World Bank get_japan_holidays(): Get official public holidays Japan given year, e.g. get_japan_holidays(2025) get_japan_hospital_beds(): Get Hospital Beds per 1,000 People Japan World Bank get_japan_life_expectancy(): Get Japan’s Life Expectancy Birth World Bank get_japan_literacy_rate(): Get Japan’s Literacy Rate (Age 15+) World Bank get_japan_population(): Get Japan’s Total Population World Bank get_japan_unemployment(): Get Japan’s Unemployment Rate World Bank get_country_info_jp(): Get Key Country Information Japan REST Countries API view_datasets_JapanAPIs(): View Available Datasets JapanAPIs functions allow users access high-quality structured information Japan, can combined tools like dplyr ggplot2 support wide range data analysis, visualization, research tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work JapanAPIs practical scenarios.

what: Japan’s GDP (Current US$) from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: japan_gdp <- head(get_japan_gdp())  print(japan_gdp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country  year   value value_label       #>   <chr>             <chr>   <int>   <dbl> <chr>             #> 1 GDP (current US$) Japan    2022 4.26e12 4,262,463,317,797 #> 2 GDP (current US$) Japan    2021 5.04e12 5,039,148,168,861 #> 3 GDP (current US$) Japan    2020 5.05e12 5,054,068,005,376 #> 4 GDP (current US$) Japan    2019 5.12e12 5,117,993,853,017 #> 5 GDP (current US$) Japan    2018 5.04e12 5,040,880,939,325 #> 6 GDP (current US$) Japan    2017 4.93e12 4,930,837,369,151

what: Japan’s Life Expectancy at Birth from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: japan_life_expectancy <- head(get_japan_life_expectancy())  print(japan_life_expectancy) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   indicator                               country  year value #>   <chr>                                   <chr>   <int> <dbl> #> 1 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2022  84.0 #> 2 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2021  84.4 #> 3 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2020  84.6 #> 4 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2019  84.4 #> 5 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2018  84.2 #> 6 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Japan    2017  84.1

what: Japan’s Total Population from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: japan_population <- head(get_japan_population())  print(japan_population) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country  year     value value_label #>   <chr>             <chr>   <int>     <int> <chr>       #> 1 Population, total Japan    2022 125124989 125,124,989 #> 2 Population, total Japan    2021 125681593 125,681,593 #> 3 Population, total Japan    2020 126261000 126,261,000 #> 4 Population, total Japan    2019 126633000 126,633,000 #> 5 Population, total Japan    2018 126811000 126,811,000 #> 6 Population, total Japan    2017 126972000 126,972,000

title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Convert time series to a tibble jpn_vehicle_prod_df <- tibble(   year = as.numeric(time(jpn_vehicle_prod_ts)),   production = as.numeric(jpn_vehicle_prod_ts) )  # Plot the time series jpn_vehicle_prod_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = production)) +   geom_line(color = "steelblue", size = 1) +   labs(     title = "Japan Vehicle Production (1947–1989)",     x = "Year",     y = "Vehicles Produced (in thousands)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset JapanAPIs labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame. _tbl_df: tibble data frame object. _ts: time series object. _vec: numeric vector object.

title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, JapanAPIs offers one largest curated collections open datasets focused Japan. preloaded datasets cover wide range topics including demography, natural disasters, public health, sports, centenarians, atomic bomb survivors, earthquakes, administrative data. featured examples: jpn_usd_exchange_df: Data frame containing weekly observations yen-dollar exchange rate 1975 1989. jpn_prefectures_tbl_df: tibble representing Japan’s 47 prefectures arranged 7x7 grid layout. kobe_quake_1995_ts: time series containing data related 1995 Kobe earthquake.

title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: JapanAPIs package offers unified interface accessing real-time data public APIs rich collection curated datasets Japan. Covering wide spectrum topics economic indicators, holidays, demographic statistics via international APIs, detailed datasets natural disasters, public health, automotive production, administrative divisions, JapanAPIs provides users reliable, structured, high-quality data. Unlike tools focus exclusively API access, JapanAPIs includes one comprehensive collections preloaded open datasets related Japan, including information centenarians, earthquake records, atomic bomb survivors, detailed regional statistics. enables deeper exploration Japan’s historical, social, economic landscape. Designed support reproducible research, education, data journalism, package empowers users analyze visualize Japan-focused data directly within R, using tidy formats well-documented sources.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

title: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, JapanAPIs offers one largest curated collections open datasets focused Japan. preloaded datasets cover wide range topics including demography, natural disasters, public health, sports, centenarians, atomic bomb survivors, earthquakes, administrative data. featured examples: jpn_usd_exchange_df: Data frame containing weekly observations yen-dollar exchange rate 1975 1989. jpn_prefectures_tbl_df: tibble representing Japan’s 47 prefectures arranged 7x7 grid layout. kobe_quake_1995_ts: time series containing data related 1995 Kobe earthquake.

title: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Load the package  library(JapanAPIs)  # Retrieves essential information about Japan  get_country_info_jp()  # Get Japan's Population (Total) from World Bank  get_japan_population()  # Load a dataset  data(japan_population_tbl_df)  # Shows six rows of the dataset  head(japan_population_tbl_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset  str(japan_population_tbl_df)  # Shows the whole dataset  View(japan_population_tbl_df)

title: Japanese Atomic Bomb Survivors — atomic_bomb_survivors_df
text: dataset, atomic_bomb_survivors_df, data frame containing frequencies cancer deaths among Japanese atomic bomb survivors, categorized extent exposure, years exposure, age group. dataset used journal Statistical Sleuth analyzed Gore et al. (2006).

title: Japanese Atomic Bomb Survivors — atomic_bomb_survivors_df
Japanese Atomic Bomb Survivors — atomic_bomb_survivors_df
text: data frame 84 observations 4 variables: Radians Radiation exposure level (integer) Count.Type Type count (factor) Count.Age.Group Age group time observation (factor) Frequency Frequency cancer deaths (integer)

title: Japanese Atomic Bomb Survivors — atomic_bomb_survivors_df
text: Data taken ACSWR package version 1.0

title: Japanese Atomic Bomb Survivors — atomic_bomb_survivors_df
text: dataset name kept 'atomic_bomb_survivors_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part JapanAPIs package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.

title: Japanese Centenarians Data — centenarian_df
text: dataset, centenarian_df, data frame containing number deaths year 1963 1980 Japanese male centenarians. data based Table 2 Emura Murotani (2015), also references original work Sibuya & Hanayama (2004).

title: Japanese Centenarians Data — centenarian_df

text: data frame 21 observations 19 variables: X Age identifier (numeric) X1963 Number deaths 1963 (integer) X1964 Number deaths 1964 (integer) X1965 Number deaths 1965 (integer) X1966 Number deaths 1966 (integer) X1967 Number deaths 1967 (integer) X1968 Number deaths 1968 (integer) X1969 Number deaths 1969 (integer) X1970 Number deaths 1970 (integer) X1971 Number deaths 1971 (integer) X1972 Number deaths 1972 (integer) X1973 Number deaths 1973 (integer) X1974 Number deaths 1974 (integer) X1975 Number deaths 1975 (integer) X1976 Number deaths 1976 (integer) X1977 Number deaths 1977 (integer) X1978 Number deaths 1978 (integer) X1979 Number deaths 1979 (integer) X1980 Number deaths 1980 (integer)

title: Earthquake Observation Stations in Japan — earthquake_station_sf

Earthquake Observation Stations in Japan — earthquake_station_sf
text: sf object 671 observations 7 variables: prefecture Name prefecture (character) area Area within prefecture (character) station_name Name observation station (character) address Physical address station (character) observation_begin Start date observation (character) observation_end End date observation, available (character) geometry XY coordinates station (sf geometry column)

title: Earthquake Observation Stations in Japan — earthquake_station_sf
text: Data taken jmastats package version 0.3.0

title: Earthquake Observation Stations in Japan — earthquake_station_sf

what: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
text: Retrieves selected, essential information Japan using REST Countries API. function returns tibble core details population, area, capital, region, official language(s). See API documentation https://restcountries.com/. Example API usage: https://restcountries.com/v3.1/name/japan?fullText=true.

title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
text: REST Countries API: https://restcountries.com/

title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
text: tibble following 8 columns: name_common: Common name country. name_official: Official name country. region: Geographical region. subregion: Subregion within continent. capital: Capital city. area: Area square kilometers. population: Population country. languages: Languages spoken country, comma-separated string.

title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
text: function sends GET request REST Countries API. API returns data Japan, function extracts returns selected fields tibble. request fails Japan found, returns NULL prints message.

title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
text: Requires internet connection. data retrieved real time REST Countries API.

title: Get Key Country Information About Japan from the REST Countries API — get_country_info_jp
code: get_country_info_jp() #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   name_common name_official region subregion capital   area population languages #>   <chr>       <chr>         <chr>  <chr>     <chr>    <dbl>      <int> <chr>     #> 1 Japan       Japan         Asia   Eastern … Tokyo   377930  125836021 Japanese

what: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
title: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
text: Retrieves list official public holidays Japan specific year using Nager.Date public holidays API. function returns tibble containing date holiday, name local language (Japanese), English name. useful academic, planning, data analysis purposes. information retrieved directly Nager.Date API reflects current status holidays requested year. field names returned consistent API structure.

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
text: Data obtained Nager.Date API: https://date.nager./

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
text: year integer indicating year (e.g., 2024 2025).

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
text: tibble following columns: date: Date holiday (class Date) local_name: Holiday name local language (Japanese) name: Holiday name English

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Japan for a Given Year — get_japan_holidays
code: get_japan_holidays(2024) #> # A tibble: 16 × 3 #>    date       local_name   name                      #>    <date>     <chr>        <chr>                     #>  1 2024-01-01 元日         New Year's Day            #>  2 2024-01-08 成人の日     Coming of Age Day         #>  3 2024-02-12 建国記念の日 Foundation Day            #>  4 2024-02-23 天皇誕生日   The Emperor's Birthday    #>  5 2024-03-20 春分の日     Vernal Equinox Day        #>  6 2024-04-29 昭和の日     Shōwa Day                 #>  7 2024-05-03 憲法記念日   Constitution Memorial Day #>  8 2024-05-04 みどりの日   Greenery Day              #>  9 2024-05-06 こどもの日   Children's Day            #> 10 2024-07-15 海の日       Marine Day                #> 11 2024-08-12 山の日       Mountain Day              #> 12 2024-09-16 敬老の日     Respect for the Aged Day  #> 13 2024-09-22 秋分の日     Autumnal Equinox Day      #> 14 2024-10-14 スポーツの日 Sports Day                #> 15 2024-11-04 文化の日     Culture Day               #> 16 2024-11-23 勤労感謝の日 Labour Thanksgiving Day   get_japan_holidays(2025) #> # A tibble: 16 × 3 #>    date       local_name   name                      #>    <date>     <chr>        <chr>                     #>  1 2025-01-01 元日         New Year's Day            #>  2 2025-01-13 成人の日     Coming of Age Day         #>  3 2025-02-11 建国記念の日 Foundation Day            #>  4 2025-02-24 天皇誕生日   The Emperor's Birthday    #>  5 2025-03-20 春分の日     Vernal Equinox Day        #>  6 2025-04-29 昭和の日     Shōwa Day                 #>  7 2025-05-03 憲法記念日   Constitution Memorial Day #>  8 2025-05-06 みどりの日   Greenery Day              #>  9 2025-05-05 こどもの日   Children's Day            #> 10 2025-07-21 海の日       Marine Day                #> 11 2025-08-11 山の日       Mountain Day              #> 12 2025-09-15 敬老の日     Respect for the Aged Day  #> 13 2025-09-23 秋分の日     Autumnal Equinox Day      #> 14 2025-10-13 スポーツの日 Sports Day                #> 15 2025-11-03 文化の日     Culture Day               #> 16 2025-11-24 勤労感謝の日 Labour Thanksgiving Day

what: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets — JapanAPIs
title: JapanAPIs: Access Japanese Data via Public APIs and Curated Datasets — JapanAPIs
text: package provides functions access data public RESTful APIs including 'Jikan API', 'Nager.Date', 'World Bank API', 'REST Countries API', retrieving real-time historical data related Japan, holidays, economic indicators, anime metadata, international demographic geopolitical indicators. Additionally, package includes one largest  curated collections open datasets focused Japan, covering topics natural disasters, economic production, vehicle industry, air quality, demographics, administrative divisions.
